intro: Agyneia glomerulata, commonly known as the clustered agyneia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
